title: Colombia: Leading Companies from the Oil Industry Gather in First Citi Industry Leadership Board: Energy Issues
summary: Bogota, Colombia – Citi Colombia will assemble industry-leading oil companies to meet in its first "Citi Industry Leadership Board: Energy Issues," where challenges and opportunities faced by the business – namely those connected with their transactional banking system – will be analyzed.
tag-1: Colombia: Leading Companies from the Oil Industry Gather in First Citi Industry Leadership Board: Energy Issues
tag-3: Bogota, Colombia – Citi Colombia will assemble industry-leading oil companies to meet in its first "Citi Industry Leadership Board: Energy Issues," where challenges and opportunities faced by the business – namely those connected with their transactional banking system – will be analyzed.
tag-4: During the meeting, which will also be held in Brazil and Peru, the objective is to work jointly in identifying industry needs and prospects regarding innovation strategies, while still taking into account the industry's accelerated growth path in the country.
tag-5: "Colombia is in immediate need of new product development in various sectors," said Bernardo Noreña, Citi Country Officer for Colombia. "That is why we are proud to be the first country initiating this event, which is focused on identifying innovative solutions for our customers."
tag-6: "Oil-sector growth carries with it the need to optimize transactional processes, and we offer technological solutions that benefit the whole value chain," said Catalina Herrera, Citi Colombia's Global Transaction Services (GTS) head. "In GTS, we continuously innovate to adapt to the sector changes and cooperate with its development."
tag-7: Citi's upper regional executives in transactional banking, including Fernando Málaga, Channel Finance regional head for GTS, shall take part in the meeting as exhibitors and members of the Leadership Board Team to guide workshops and discussions, as well as support the sector expert consultants.
tag-8: Through its Securities and Fund Services, Citi experts provide global investors with tailored solutions, managed on tested global platforms, with an open and functional architecture. With US$12.6 trillion in assets in custody and with the largest industry ownership network, customers may benefit from Citi's local market expertise, as well as from its global scope, to obtain credit throughout all value chains.
tag-9: Global Transaction Services Global Transaction Services (GTS), a division of Citigroup's Institutional Clients Group (IGG), offers integral administrative services in cash, brokerage, values and funds to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector entities from all over the world. With a network covering over 100 countries, Citigroup's Global Transactional Services renders services to over 65,000 customers. Up to IV QTR 2010, it had an average of US$ 353 billions in passive balances and US$ 12,6 billions in assets in custody.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
